headline: FedEx board member tapped to lead U.S. Postal Service
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -The U.S. Postal Service Board on Friday said it named David Steiner, a FedEx board member and former CEO of Waste Management, as the new postmaster general after the White House pressured the prior leader to resign in March.  Postal unions have raised sharp concerns about Steiner's selection to succeed Postmaster General Louis DeJoy because he sits on the board of a competitor to the Postal Service.  The Postal Service reported a wider net loss of $3.3 billion for the three months ending March 31 as it  continues to hike stamp prices and seek ways to cut costs.

headline: Six Facts About David Steiner, the New U.S. Postmaster General
summary: President Trump’s new pick for postmaster general is a  FedEx  director who led a turnaround of a waste-and-recycling firm after an insider trading scandal.  1. He spearheaded a comeback for Waste Management.  Steiner joined the company as deputy general counsel in 2000 and in less than four years climbed the ranks to become CEO.

headline: USPS board taps FedEx director David Steiner as next postmaster general
summary: David Steiner, former CEO of Waste Management, is slated to join the agency in July as it navigates Trump administration pressures and advances its transformation plan.
